page.title: 03Stowmarket Ecology:continued
page.content: 4.Green's Meadow, a recreational site owned by Mid-Suffolk District Council, is based on a landscaped rubbish-tip. 5.There is a peaty area in the bottom of the valley-which is why the railway embankment was floated on hazel faggots. 6.Some flower-rich meadows in the Gipping valley will eventually become the property of the Museum of East Anglian Life. 7.A large, good specimen of the native black poplar is growing in Mill Street. 8.The pond off Gainsborough Rd currently has Great Crested Newts, a protected species. 9.A planned walk along the Gipping valley starts in Stowmarket-testimony to the interest shown by some of the population in their environment.
